page.title: 16LOCAL NEWS-JUNE & JULY 1985
page.content: {COTSWOLD AREA OF OUTSTANDING BEAUTY -In order to encourage conservation, give grants towards tree planting and remove eyesores, Countryside Commission wants to extend 580 square miles{AONB}southwards to include countryside and villages in this area. {FUND RAISING}-Five 10-13 year old girls in Larkhall raised{Â£60}for{Bath {Cancer Unit}by collecting and selling secondhand clothing and effects. {TAKEAWAY PLAN REFUSAL -City Council refused to give permission for conversion of old bakery in Larkhall to a{takeaway}selling{beefburbers. {TRANSPORT CAFE}-Green Lantern Cafe on A4 at Batheaston demolished by order of Department of Transport.Complaints from residents that site was a disgrace to the area.{Squatters}had occupied the derelict cafe.{Artist lost appeal for use as{Arts Workshop.
